# tw-easing-gradients

> A Tailwind CSS v4 plugin for smooth, naturally blending gradients using cubic bezier easing and oklch color interpolation.

## Overview

tw-easing-gradients solves the problem of harsh color transitions in CSS gradients. By applying easing functions (ease, ease-in, ease-out, ease-in-out) to gradient color stops and using the perceptually uniform OKLCH color space, it creates gradients that look natural and blend seamlessly.

## Key Features

- Cubic Bezier easing functions for smooth color distribution
- OKLCH color space interpolation (perceptually uniform)
- 8 gradient directions (top, right, bottom, left, and diagonals)
- Transparency fade support (color to transparent)
- Configurable number of stops (2-100, default: 15)

## Installation

npm install tw-easing-gradients

## Usage

Add to your CSS:
@import 'tailwindcss';
@plugin "tw-easing-gradients";

Use in HTML:
<div class="bg-ease-in-out-to-br from-violet-600 to-pink-500">
